page.title: 13LEESON HOUSE SWANAGE
page.content: Leeson House is a special type of school and Field Study Centre, where each year, many people go to study nature and wildlife. In the grounds there are many small wild animals and the biggest rookery in the Purbeck area. There are also two man-made ponds where pond life is studied. Children stay there for a week or a weekend. They can also visit Durlston or Studland to study the wildlife. They can go on coastal walks, spot sea birds, visit one of the many farms, visit Corfe Castle, or study the many rocks on the surrounding hills. In the evening they write up and discuss the day's study. It is open most of the year and is funded by the Dorset County Council, but people are asked to pay a small fee towards the cost of the food.
